titleStmt.title: Phraseologia puerilis, Anglo-Latina, in usum tirocinii scholastici. Or, selected Latine and English phrases wherein the purity and propriety of both languages is expressed. Very usefull for young Latinists, to prevent barbarismes, and bald Latine-making, and to initiate them in speaking and writing elegantly in both languages. By I. Clarke B.D. and Master of the Free Schoole in Lincolne.
titleStmt.author: Clarke, John, d. 1658.

titleStmt.title: Phraseologia puerilis, Anglo-Latina, in usum tirocinii scholastici. Or, selected Latine and English phrases wherein the purity and propriety of both languages is expressed. Very usefull for young Latinists, to prevent barbarismes, and bald Latine-making, and to initiate them in speaking and writing elegantly in both languages. By I. Clarke B.D. and Master of the Free Schoole in Lincolne.
titleStmt.author: Clarke, John, d. 1658.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston for Robert Mylbourne, and are to be sold at the signe of the Unicorne neere Fleet-bridge,

notesStmt.note: The first and last leaves are blank.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
